text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time
for a review of the new marina project
ancient dreams in a modern land this is
a brand
new album from pop singer marina
lambrini diamandis
formerly marina and the diamonds now
simply marina
it's her fifth full-length lp her first
for this decade
and artistically speaking for marina
this
project is a bit of a different outing
since shortening her name i feel like
marine has been kind of
reinventing herself artistically getting
a bit more ambitious with her music like
her
double dose of love and fear on her 2019
record
and ancient dreams in a modern land
isn't nearly as long an album but
somehow it still feels bigger
in terms of attitude message
instrumentals
in so many ways it sounds like she's
beyond the point of giving a while
also taking us back to the 80s
with these grand presentations of synth
heavy pop and rock
so on quite a few tracks here she's
recreating the instrumental aesthetics
of that era
which seems to be a very prevalent trend
in the pop world at this point you can't
really listen through a popular music
playlist
these days without being hit by at least
like four or five
80s throwbacks but marina is really
embracing the camp
of this era of music too and then
topping it with these totally unfiltered
takes on
america capitalism patriarchy female
empowerment and the human condition
which are very heavy topics for a 36
minute pop record but marina's concrete
bluntness on many of these tracks
makes them go off like an atomic bomb
case in point the track purged the
poison
which reads like a we didn't start the
fire for the
2010s and aughts combing through some of
the cultural chaos
of these decades from britney shaving
her head to the metoo movement
from the destruction of our environment
to all-out war
likening the toxicity driving these
events to a poison that must be purged
from humanity
ultimately saying she wants a world
where she can see the feminine which
rings like a battle cry over these
screaming guitars and synths
very bright very blaring it's excessive
but it gives the message of the song so
much weight
plus the camp in the lead vocals and the
melodies throughout the track
it makes the whole thing sound kind of
like the the theme song
to a tv show where a teen girl um
gains incredible powers or something
which is kind of the vibe on multiple
tracks here i mean
some of you watching may be too young to
know what the hell i'm talking about
i can't completely put it into words but
believe me when i say there are tracks
on this thing that have a
mid-90s sci-fi drama canceled after two
seasons vibe
like with the track new america i close
my eyes and i see
a cast of characters just being montaged
in front of me
as the names of the actors that play
them uh
just sort of roll out underneath and
look this is just a very surprising
sound and energy to bring to any pop
album
and i'm just a little shocked that it's
repurposed
and uh brought back to life so sincerely
and creatively
now occasionally with this sound i do
think marina goes a tad bit overboard to
a degree i think there are passages of
new america that feel
slightly cultish in a way where the song
almost becomes a bit
what it's trying to satirize and for
sure i know that she was capable of
better writing than
america america then there's the title
track which
sounds like trying to fit a whole
manifesto into a straightforward new
wave rocker
there are parts of it that are wordy to
a fault between the phil collins drum
fills
and the somewhat preachy non-conformity
mantras
it's it's a lot it's a lot however i
wouldn't necessarily trade it for
something milder
because for me that's exactly where this
lp falters on the tracks that just seem
way less out there frankly less urgent
in message too
like the track pandora's box which is
just one
instrumental swell away from being a bad
overblown millennial pop
sad anthem the quirk on this one is just
too much to bear
but that's also pretty much what the
closer goodbye actually is
if i hear another song with this exact
piano progression
with a singer on top of it trying to
just be like way too
frank and they're just like being as as
real as possible it's just going to be
too soon
overall i do like the sentiment of the
song marina saying goodbye to a part of
herself
in a way but there has to have been a
better tune to pair this with
i feel more or less the same about the
track flowers 2 which kicks off in a way
like a
sad little regina specter-esque piano
ballad with some classically influenced
vocals and melodies here and there
but the stripped back piano instrumental
is frankly bland
and some of the lyrics read like
something someone would post
as inspiration after a breakup on their
tumblr or their pinterest
then highly emotional people is another
moment on the record where
i really mess with the message and the
sentiment of the song embracing the idea
of sharing your emotions and being a
vulnerable person especially as a guy
but man for some reason this track sure
does sound like lana del rey calling out
over
some new agey layers of vocal harmonies
and scents for some reason
these spots on the record for me are
just really tough to reconcile because
they're nowhere near as good nor do they
really feel consistent with the
rowdier and more socially charged spots
on this lp
i love you but i love me more was
another highlight for me though
the haunting bittersweet melodies over
more thunderous pop production was great
then the song man's world is really
one of the best tracks here in terms of
commentary really targeting the
hypocrisy as well as tragedy of
male power structures for me this track
in so many ways is just
a distillation of pure beauty and power
while also having a lot to say about
women over history being sidelined the
persecution of lgbtq people
the lushness of this instrumental too is
incredible and
this is one of the few tracks here that
finds a balance between being a ballad
and also a banger so
overall i did like this lp i think it
has to be one of my favorites that i've
heard from marina so far
but the highlights are just too few and
far between from the mellower spots
hitting one way and the anthems hitting
another
this project for me was kind of lopsided
surely there are some great
exciting and novel ideas here and plus
it is
refreshing to hear a pop record approach
with such radical ideas on gender issues
the economy the state of the world in
general but
as an entire statement and experience
there's just not enough follow through
feeling a light six on this one

what would you rate it you're the best
